dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Appointment of Justice of the Peace

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:12232909

Date of creation: (unknown)

Petition location: Westborough

Selected signatures:

  1. Gosen Chamberlain
  2. Gardner Cloyes
  3. Thomas Stone

Total signatures: 142

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 142

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: legal voters

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional non-petition or unrelated documents available at archive: additional documents available

Additional archivist notes: Nahum Harrington, justice of the peace, Worcester county, ought not to be recommissioned, maladministration, infirm, irritable temper and disposition, passions, Joseph Baxter, Daniel Bowman, disorderly, vagrant, vagabond, idle, begging, 1837, witnesses, charges, imprisonment, house of correction in Worcester, stranger, evidence, beggar, 1842, Homan Halleck, Isaac F. Warren, 1838, Russell Bowman, common drunkard, testimony, contemptuous language, trial, misconduct, depositions, Southborough, Peter Fay, purchased exemption from a legal investigation, extreme clemency, chief magistrate, matter of duty as your citizens, deprived of their personal freedom under the sanction of law, do not feel at liberty to be silent

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Governor Council Files, December 19, 1842, Case of Nahum Harrington
